title: ‘Provided food, shelter’: 2 held for aiding Pahalgam attack terrorists; disclose 3 were Pak LeT men
content: NIA apprehended Parvaiz Ahmad Jothar and Bashir Ahmad Jothar for providing shelter and support to LeT terrorists involved in the Pahalgam attack. The accused harbored the Pakistani attackers in a seasonal hut before the assault, which targeted tourists in Baisaran Valley based on their religious identity. The duo has been booked under UAPA, and further investigation is under way.

title: 'Had the audacity to mourn': CCTV shows Raj at Raja Raghuwanshi’s funeral - video
content: New CCTV footage in the Raja Raghuvanshi murder case reveals prime suspect Raj Kushwaha present at the funeral, holding a shroud and garland. He was seen consoling the victim's father while making suspicious phone calls, raising concerns about relaying real-time updates, possibly to Sonam.

title: 'What is the tone?' - Gambhir slammed after Pant’s 'brainfade' dismissal
content: Rishabh Pant's magnificent century at Headingley, surpassing MS Dhoni's record, was marred by a late innings collapse for India. Pant's 134, along with centuries from Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill, propelled India to 471. However, a sudden loss of wickets saw England's Josh Tongue and Ben Stokes restrict India.

title: Israel-Iran war: What are B-2 bombers used by US to strike Iran? How they work
content: In a dramatic escalation, the United States has directly intervened in the Israel-Iran conflict, with President Trump announcing targeted airstrikes on three Iranian nuclear facilities, including Fordow, Natanz, and Esfahan. The operation, executed with precision, reportedly utilized B-2 Spirit bombers, known for their stealth capabilities and capacity to carry massive ordnance.

title: GitHub CEO to software engineers: ‘Key for winning’ AI coding tools is in ….
content: GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke emphasizes the importance of developers retaining hands-on coding skills alongside AI tools. He warns against over-reliance on AI-generated code, advocating for a flexible workflow where developers can seamlessly switch between AI assistance and direct coding.

title: Mumbaikar instinct kicks in: Flyer misses flight, sprints on runway to board it; arrested
content: In a bizarre incident at Mumbai airport, Piyush Soni, a 25-year-old man, was arrested for trespassing onto the apron after missing his flight to Patna. Security spotted Soni running towards an Air India plane that had arrived from Bhuj, unaware his flight had already departed. He falsely claimed a coach driver dropped him near the runway.

title: Tech vs MBA? Narayana Murthy to young grads; there’s no real difference; what matters is…
content: Infosys co-founder NR Narayana Murthy believes that both management and technology graduates hold equal importance in the age of AI. He argues that they approach problem-solving from different angles, with management focusing on 'what' and technology on 'how.' Murthy views AI as a tool that enhances productivity across disciplines, expressing optimism about India's talent pool in both fields.

title: 'No one expected him to do that' - Who said what about Pant's somersault celebration?
content: Rishabh Pant captivated Headingley with a stunning century and an unexpected somersault celebration, overshadowing his impressive innings. His audacious move drew admiration from teammates and former cricketers like Dinesh Karthik and Ravi Shastri. Pant's explosive innings, coupled with Shubman Gill's 147, propelled India past 400, but it was the fearless flip that truly defined the moment, embodying Pant's unique spirit.

title: 'Not working with India has a cost': Jaishankar on ties with neighbours
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar emphasized that India must be prepared to confront China, especially after the Galwan clash, and highlighted the importance of border infrastructure. He noted the necessity of a beneficial relationship with India for its neighbors, except Pakistan, due to its military's inherent hostility.

title: IND vs ENG: Sourav Ganguly warns Shubman Gill - 'India won't get ...'
content: Sourav Ganguly wants India to secure victory in the first Test match against England. India batted first and scored 471 runs. Yashasvi Jaiswal, Shubman Gill, and Rishabh Pant made centuries. Ganguly feels India must capitalize on this opportunity. Jasprit Bumrah took Joe Root's wicket. England reached 209 for 3 at stumps on Day Two, trailing by 262 runs.

title: How Bill Gates and Melinda Gates reacted when their daughter announced her startup
content: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, has launched Phia, an e-commerce app co-founded with Sophia Kianni. The platform utilizes AI to compare prices across numerous websites, offering users a comprehensive view of both new and second-hand fashion items. Bill Gates initially expressed concern about potential financial requests and involvement but ultimately supported Phoebe's entrepreneurial endeavor.

title: 'Full payload of bombs dropped': US joins Israel's war against Iran — 10 key developments
content: In a dramatic turn, President Trump announced US military strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities at Fordow, Natanz, and Isfahan, marking a direct intervention in the escalating conflict between Israel and Iran. The strikes, utilizing B-2 stealth bombers, targeted Iran's uranium enrichment program. This decision reverses Trump's earlier stance on avoiding foreign wars and raises concerns about potential Iranian retaliation.

title: London-bound flight returns to Chennai after take-off; 'operational reason' cited
content: A British Airways flight from Chennai to London was compelled to return mid-air due to the closure of Iranian airspace, reportedly following US strikes on Iranian nuclear sites. The flight, carrying 206 passengers, landed safely back in Chennai, and passengers were provided refreshments.

title: 'Suja diya maar maar ke!' Pant's stump mic moment goes viral - Watch
content: Rishabh Pant's words and batting display grabbed attention at Headingley. His aggressive 134 and stump mic comments went viral. Sachin Tendulkar praised Pant's innovative shot-making. Shubman Gill also scored a century. Their partnership helped India reach a substantial total. Jasprit Bumrah's wickets kept India in control despite England's fightback led by Ollie Pope.

title: Jon Jones retires from UFC as fresh legal trouble shadows final exit
content: Jon Jones has announced his retirement from the UFC, marking the end of a controversial yet dominant career highlighted by Light Heavyweight and Heavyweight titles. His farewell was quickly overshadowed by reports of a new legal issue, as he faces a criminal summons for allegedly fleeing the scene of an accident in February.

title: US strikes Iran: WH shares images of Trump inside Situation Room; see pics
content: In a significant escalation, the US has directly entered the Israel-Iran conflict, launching airstrikes on key Iranian nuclear facilities. President Trump confirmed the operation, stating the goal was to eliminate Iran's uranium enrichment capacity. Iran acknowledged the attacks, warning of retaliation.

title: Skills crunch ahead: JPMorgan CEO to US companies; you're falling short time to reskill or …
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon warns American businesses about a critical skills shortage, not just a worker shortage. He urges corporate leaders to collaborate with schools to bridge the talent gap in cybersecurity, coding, and financial literacy. Dimon advocates for companies to invest in education pipelines and promote curricula that integrate job-ready skills with academics to foster economic growth.

title: Work smarter: Google CEO’s top 10 tips to boost your productivity, and become ‘enormously valuable’
content: Sundar Pichai's journey from India to Google's CEO showcases his leadership and productivity. His strategies emphasize quick decisions, continuous learning, and work-life balance. Pichai's approach includes empathy, clear communication, and embracing change, offering valuable lessons for professional growth and leadership development, highlighting the importance of impact and long-term vision.

title: 'Spectacular military success': Which nuclear sites did US strike in Iran? Why it matters
content: President Trump announced US precision airstrikes on Iran's key nuclear facilities: Fordow, Natanz, and Isfahan. The strikes followed escalating tensions after Israel's offensive against Iran's nuclear program, with Iran retaliating earlier in the week. These targeted sites are critical to Iran's uranium enrichment and nuclear research efforts, placing the region at a dangerous crossroads.

title: Maharashtra teacher sleeps for 30 mins in classroom; probe ordered
content: A government school teacher in Maharashtra's Jalna district is under scrutiny after a video surfaced showing him asleep during class. The incident took place at a zilla parishad school in Gadegavan village, where students from Class I to V were present. Authorities have confirmed the teacher's identity and assured that strict disciplinary action will be taken following an investigation.

title: 'The bully must now make peace': What Trump said after Iran strike; top quotes
content: President Trump announced US military strikes on Iran's nuclear facilities, citing the need to halt its nuclear program and address its support for terrorism. The operation, which severely damaged key sites, followed Israeli airstrikes targeting Iranian air defenses. Trump praised Prime Minister Netanyahu and the Israeli military for their collaboration, warning Iran of potential consequences if it doesn't pursue peace.

title: Watch: Chris Gayle at racecourse; his attire steals the show
content: West Indies cricket legend Chris Gayle added fun to Royal Ascot. He wore a black coat and hat. Gayle joked about winning the best-dressed award. He expressed his love for London. He also shared his experience betting on a horse. Gayle's cricket records include impressive stats in Tests, ODIs, and T20Is. He entertained fans both on and off the field.

title: 'Came for one-day, never left': 22-yr-old sneaks into IIT-Bombay, stays in hostel; booked
content: A 22-year-old man from Mangaluru, Bilal Teli, has been booked by Powai police for trespassing and attending classes at IIT Powai campus without authorization. Teli, who stayed on campus from June 4th, was apprehended after a professor asked for his ID. Authorities found nothing suspicious, with Teli claiming he only wanted to attend engineering lectures.

title: New record! Root leaves Jayasuriya behind; batter now becomes ...
content: Joe Root surpassed Sanath Jayasuriya, becoming the ninth-highest international run-scorer during England's Test against India. Root scored 28 runs before Jasprit Bumrah dismissed him. India posted 471, with centuries from Jaiswal, Gill, and Pant. England ended day two at 209/3, with Pope unbeaten on 100. Bumrah's three wickets troubled England, who trail by 262 runs.

title: Salman Khan opens up about health: 'Trigeminal Neuralgia tha..Aneurysm hai brain me'
content: Salman Khan, known for his strength and charm, has been battling several painful health conditions, including trigeminal neuralgia, a brain aneurysm, and arteriovenous malformations. Despite these challenges, he continues to work tirelessly, driven by his commitment to his profession. He jokingly expressed concerns about potential divorces impacting his hard-earned fortune, given his dedication to work amidst health struggles.

title: Israel security agencies warn people: Turn off your home security cameras or ...
content: Cybersecurity experts reveal Iran is hacking into Israeli security cameras to gather intelligence, mirroring tactics used by Hamas and Russia in Ukraine. This surge in cyberattacks aims to assess missile impact sites and refine precision, prompting urgent warnings for citizens to secure their devices. The escalating cyberwar highlights the vulnerability of internet-connected devices amid global conflicts.

title: Panel probing Varma's house fire spotted 'unidentified man' near burnt cash
content: A judges committee investigating the 'cash in kothi' case involving Justice Yashwant Varma has raised suspicions about an unidentified man seen near the burnt currency sacks. The panel suggests this individual may have collaborated with Justice Varma's staff to remove cash between 1 am and 7 am.

title: IND vs ENG: Bumrah memes break internet as India pacer leads solo charge against England
content: Day 2 of the IND vs ENG Test at Headingley was filled with drama, highlighted by Jasprit Bumrah's menacing bowling. Despite Ollie Pope's resilient century, Bumrah's three wickets and near-misses dominated the game and social media. India's earlier batting collapse, losing 7 wickets for 41 runs, also fueled online humor.

title: FATF flags Pakistan bid to ship in missile gear from China on sly
content: A Financial Action Task Force report reveals Pakistan's alleged attempts to procure missile equipment by mislabeling shipments, raising concerns about its commitment to preventing weapons proliferation financing. The report links the importer to Pakistan's National Development Complex.

title: IND vs ENG: Drama in Leeds! From Bumrah's fire to India's butter fingers
content: At Headingley, England capitalized on India's batting collapse and fielding errors to dominate Day 2. Despite a strong start by India, England's bowlers triggered a collapse, limiting India's score. Jasprit Bumrah bowled with intensity, but dropped catches and lack of support from the other end allowed England to build a strong reply, leaving the hosts in a more advantageous position.

title: Refunds, advance tax dip: Net direct mop-up down 1.4% to Rs 4.6 Lakh crore
content: Gross direct tax collections saw a modest increase of under 5% up to June 19, with advance tax receipts growing at a muted 3.9%, signaling potential concerns about corporate profit growth. Net direct tax collections dipped slightly due to a significant surge in refunds, reflecting the finance minister's push for quicker disbursal.

title: Legendary actor Jack Betts passes away at 96
content: Jack Betts, the prolific actor celebrated for his roles in 'Spider-Man,' 'Friends,' and numerous spaghetti westerns, has died at 96. Dean Sullivan, his nephew, confirmed that Betts passed away peacefully in his sleep at his California home on June 19. He was also known for his close friendship with Doris Roberts, with whom he frequently attended events.

title: Tom Brady picks LeBron James as basketball’s GOAT; cites longevity, resilience
content: Tom Brady, the NFL legend, picked Lebron James over Michael Jordan at Fanatics Fest in New York. Brady praised James's resilience and consistency. He highlighted James's present-day impact. Brady's endorsement sparked fresh debate among fans and athletes. This is about the greatest basketball player. The debate continues between Jordan and James. This endorsement guarantees the debate continues and grows.

title: Aamir Khan starrer ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ witnesses growth on Saturday,
content: Aamir Khan and Genelia D’Souza's ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ has captivated audiences, earning positive reviews and impressive box office numbers. The film has already crossed the Rs. 30 crore mark in just two days, surpassing 'Housefull 5'. The plot revolves around a suspended basketball coach, played by Aamir Khan, who finds redemption while training athletes with intellectual disabilities for a national tournament.

title: Heavy rainfall alerts in several northwest states as monsoon advances
content: The India Meteorological Department has issued red and orange alerts for extremely heavy rainfall across several states in the coming week. Northwest India is expected to receive significant rainfall from June 21-27, with heavy showers in Jammu-Kashmir-Ladakh, Himachal Pradesh, and Uttarakhand.

title: Operation Sindhu: 1,100 Indians back from Iran; 800 more seek evacuation
content: India has been actively evacuating its citizens from Iran amidst escalating tensions, with over 827 nationals already returned and plans underway to bring back hundreds more. Around 800 Indians have approached the embassy in Tehran for evacuation, with the total number of evacuees expected to exceed 1,100 soon.

title: Blake Lively heartbroken as friendship with Taylor Swift ends; accepts it's over
content: The friendship between Blake Lively and Taylor Swift has reportedly ended after months of silence, leaving Lively heartbroken. Sources claim Swift feels betrayed, accusing Lively of exploiting their relationship and manipulating the public. This fallout coincides with Lively being ordered to submit text messages related to Justin Baldoni's legal battle, further complicating the situation.

title: EC: Sharing video footage of booth breaches voters' privacy
content: Election Commission officials defended the amendment restricting access to poll-day webcasting feeds, citing voter privacy and protection from intimidation. They emphasized that the footage is an internal tool, not for public sharing, aligning with legal obligations to protect voter secrecy.

title: IND vs ENG: Bumrah holds animated chat with Gambhir; pic goes viral
content: Jasprit Bumrah's fiery performance and animated conversation with coach Gautam Gambhir grabbed attention during the first Test. Bumrah's three wickets, including the crucial scalp of Joe Root, kept India in the game despite dropped catches. India's batting collapse after centuries from Shubman Gill and Rishabh Pant allowed England to fight back, setting the stage for a thrilling contest.

title: 'Aggressive doesn't mean he can't defend': Batting coach backs Pant, hails Gill's growth
content: Ollie Pope's resilient century kept England afloat on Day Two of the Headingley Test, responding to India's imposing 471. Jasprit Bumrah's three wickets rattled the English top order, but Pope's unbeaten 100* alongside Harry Brook's solid support, steered England to 209 for 3.

title: 'Because matter became public?': Priyank Kharge questions MEA's U-turn on US visit
content: Priyanka Kharge, Karnataka minister, announced that the Union government reversed its decision. He received permission for an official US visit. The Ministry of External Affairs issued an NOC after initially denying clearance. Kharge questioned the initial denial and timing. He highlighted Karnataka's role in national initiatives. He also emphasized the need for answers from the central government regarding the matter.

title: All adults overweight in every 5th Indian household: Study
content: A recent study reveals that nearly 20% of Indian households have all adults classified as overweight, while 10% are obese. States like Manipur and Kerala show over 30% of households with all adults overweight. Researchers emphasize the need for family-centered obesity prevention strategies, as obesity clusters within families significantly increase the risk of non-communicable diseases like diabetes and heart conditions.

title: India emerging as wellness hub: PM Modi on yoga day
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi declared India as a burgeoning global wellness hub under the 'Heal in India' initiative, emphasizing yoga's pivotal role. Addressing a record-breaking gathering in Visakhapatnam, Modi highlighted yoga's integration into modern medicine, citing AIIMS-Delhi's research.

title: 1st Test: Pant’s flair, Bumrah’s fire, but Pope stands tall to keep England afloat
content: Rishabh Pant's explosive century and Jasprit Bumrah's fiery spell initially put India in a commanding position at Headingley. However, Ollie Pope's resilient, unbeaten hundred, coupled with crucial partnerships, allowed England to weather the storm and reach 209 for 3 in response to India's 471. Despite a late breakthrough by Bumrah, England's grit, led by Pope, kept them in the game.

title: What an NBA title would mean for two generations of Pacers legends
content: Metta Sandiford-Artest, Rik Smits and other Pacers legends reflect on what a title would mean for the city.

title: Anderson's shutout has LSU on brink of MCWS title
content: Kade Anderson pitched a three-hitter as LSU moved within a win of its second national championship in three years with a 1-0 victory over Coastal Carolina.

title: Jones, 37, retires; White: Aspinall now champion
content: Jon Jones, 37, widely considered the greatest mixed martial artist of all time, has retired, UFC CEO Dana White announced on Saturday, and the heavyweight later confirmed the decision on social media, saying the decision came "after a lot of reflection."

title: Devers goes deep vs. Red Sox, downplays homer
content: Rafael Devers' first home run as a Giant came against his former teammates in Boston on Saturday, but he said it was "nothing more special than any other home run that I've hit."

title: Sources: Bucks' Connaughton picks up option
content: Milwaukee Bucks guard Pat Connaughton has exercised his $9.4 million player option for the 2025-26 season, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Extreme heat ails Reds' De La Cruz, M's Thornton
content: Reds shortstop Elly De La Cruz and Mariners reliever Trent Thornton fell ill while playing in temperatures that exceeded 90 degrees.

title: Fleetwood atop Travelers as 1st tour win in sight
content: Tommy Fleetwood never missed a fairway and seized on the good scoring conditions for a 7-under 63 for a three-shot lead going into the final round of the Travelers Championship.

title: Reds prospect Burns will make MLB debut Tuesday
content: Chase Burns, 22, the No. 2 overall pick in the 2024 MLB draft who has excelled at three levels of the minor leagues this season, will be promoted so that he can make his major league debut for the Cincinnati Reds on Tuesday against the New York Yankees.

title: Liberty's Jones out 4-6 weeks with ankle sprain
content: New York Liberty center Jonquel Jones, 31, the 2021 WNBA MVP and Finals MVP in 2024, will miss four to six weeks with a right ankle sprain, the team announced Saturday. But after further imaging and evaluation, she avoided long-term injury.

title: 👀 How the Red Sox 'botched' Devers divorce
content: As Devers prepares to play against his former team, a look inside the clubhouse culture that helped cause the divorce.

title: Jon Jones' MMA résumé isn't ruined by not fighting Tom Aspinall
content: No, the last chapter of Jon Jones' UFC career doesn't negate his legacy, yet it does add a "but" to the end.

content: For clubs currently leading the postseason hunt, here's the one thing most driving their success so far.

title: 5 storylines, 12 players and 1 defining NBA offseason coming up
content: From Giannis' future, to KD's, to all 15 teams in the West competing for the playoffs, here are the biggest stories this offseason. And how they resolve could dramatically impact next season.

content: ESPN's writers share their takeaways from the first week of the tournament. Here's what you need to know from Saturday in the Club World Cup.

title: 'He can do anything': Why Liverpool spent big to sign Wirtz
content: Liverpool have broken their transfer record to sign Wirtz from Bayer Leverkusen for an initial £100m.

title: USMNT's Wright (Achilles) out for rest of Gold Cup
content: USMNT forward Haji Wright has been ruled out for the remainder of the Concacaf Gold Cup with an Achilles injury, U.S. Soccer announced on Saturday.

title: Jobe Bellingham: First Dortmund goal 'surreal'
content: Jobe Bellingham said his first goal for Borussia Dortmund was a surreal experience as the new signing made an immediate impact at the Club World Cup.

title: Pep: Some City players will be 'sad' if they stay
content: Pep Guardiola has suggested he will slim down his Manchester City squad before the end of the transfer window to avoid having "sad" players next season.

title: Inter snatch late win to break Urawa Reds' hearts
content: Valentin Carboni scored in the second minute of second-half stoppage time to complete Inter Milan's rally to a 2-1 victory over Urawa Red Diamonds.

title: Cazorla helps Oviedo end 24-year LaLiga absence
content: Real Oviedo sealed their return to LaLiga after 24 years with a 3-2 aggregate victory over Mirandes in Saturday's promotion play-off.

title: Frimpong: Wirtz makes Liverpool move 'extra fun'
content: Jeremie Frimpong has told ESPN the arrival of Florian Wirtz, his former Bayer Leverkusen teammate, at Liverpool has made his move "extra fun."

title: Sources: Onana wants Man Utd stay this summer
content: André Onana is keen to stay at Manchester United despite interest from Monaco, sources have told ESPN.

title: Rankings of MLB starters, relievers and their arsenal of pitches over the past three seasons
content: A stat rooted in Game Theory reveals who's maximizing their arsenals, and who's leaving outs on the table.

title: The USMNT is a mess. That's the price of the U.S. becoming a 'soccer country'
content: The more the U.S. cares about soccer and produces better players, the more dysfunctional the USMNT becomes. That's just how it is.

title: 'The Lakers can finally be run like a real business': Leaguewide reaction to the stunning sale
content: The Lakers have spent decades lagging behind other NBA teams in ways known -- and not. This sale presents a massive opportunity for them to catch up -- and expedite their chase for title No. 18.

content: Chelsea broke the women's transfer world record for Naomi Girma in January and are targeting more USWNT stars, but how can their transfer strategy push them to UWCL glory?

content: Matt Miller and Jordan Reid stack their early top-fives at every position and break down the players they'll be watching during the 2025 season.

content: Gadget player, slot cornerback, swing tackle, backup quarterback -- these players are the best at their very specific roles.

content: Martim Fernandes has emerged as a key target for Arsenal and Man City, among others. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: At Jackie Robinson's high school, a fire-ravaged city rebuilds
content: After 1 in 4 students lost their homes or were displaced by the Eaton fire, their school held them together.

title: Rematch review -- a soccer game that's brilliant even if you don't like the sport
content: Sloclap's soccer simulation pares the beautiful game down to the essentials -- and it's a blast to play.

title: Israel-Iran tension: B-2 bombers move from US, refueled shortly after take-off
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, providing a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers .

title: US Action Against Iran Saves Us From Nuclear Catastrophe: Israel Ambassador To NDTV
content: The United States' bombing of nuclear sites in Iran is historic and the leadership of President Donald Trump has proven to be "amazing", Israeli Ambassador to India Reuven Azar has said.

title: On Camera, Destruction In Tel Aviv After Iran Fires Missiles
content: Iran launched a barrage of missiles at Israel on Sunday, hours after the US joined the Israeli military's campaign and bombed three nuclear sites at the Islamic country.

title: Geopolitical Tensions Impact Indian Workplaces As Firms Freeze Hiring: Report
content: Over 21 per cent said there is an increase in workload pressure and project timelines while 22 per cent reported that international business exposure or travel is disrupted.

title: Woman Pilot Harassed By Cab Driver. He Changed Route, Allowed 2 Men To Sit
content: The incident took place around 11.15 pm on Thursday when the woman was heading back to her house in Ghatkopar from south Mumbai.

title: Trump Sought 2-Week Window For Iran: What Made Him Attack In 2 Days
content: US President Donald Trump distanced himself from his self-proclaimed peacemaker claim, with "spectacular" strikes on three nuclear facilities in Iran early this morning.

title: Iran Hits Israeli Sites, Ben Gurion Airport After US Strike, Israel Fires Back
content: Iran and Israel have been trading missile and drone strikes since the conflict between the two Middle Eastern countries began last Friday.

title: 5 Possible Scenarios For Iran, Israel As US Joins War
content: The United States on Sunday targeted three nuclear sites in Iran, as it intervened in the ongoing conflict between the Islamic Republic and Israel and triggered fears of dangerous escalation of tensions across the Middle East.

title: SpiceJet To Pay Rs 25,000 Compensation To Passenger For Issuing Wrong Ticket
content: SpiceJet, in its defense, argued the flight cancellation was due to bad weather, an instance beyond its control, and its liability is limited as per the Carriage by Air Act, 1972.

title: All About Tomahawk Missiles US Used In Strikes On Iran's Nuclear Sites
content: The US has entered Israel's war with Iran, launching precision strikes on Tehran's key nuclear facilitiesusing Tomahawk cruise missilesand GBU-57 bunker busters.

title: US Bombs 3 Nuclear Sites In Iran, Tehran And Israel Launch Strikes Against Each Other
content: President Donald Trump on Sunday said that the US has bombed three nuclear sites in Iran, joining Israel's war against Tehran.

title: BJP Banks On Lord Muruga Conference To Revive Tamil Nadu Hopes Ahead Of 2026
content: In a high-profile show of saffron strength, the BJP is banking on a grand conference on Lord Muruga in Madurai to expand its footprint in Tamil Nadu ahead of the 2026 Assembly elections.

title: After Iran, India Begins Operation To Evacuate Indian Nationals From Israel
content: India has started to evacuate its nationals from Israel as the ongoing conflict in the Middle East escalated with the US attacking three nuclear sites in Iran on Sunday, sources said.

title: Israel-Iran News LIVE: Israel Launches New Attack On Iran After 16 Hurt In Iranian Strikes
content: US-Israel-Iran Conflict LIVE Updates: The United States on Sunday carried out a "very successful attack" on three nuclear sites in Iran, President Donald Trump said late on Saturday.

title: Washington, New York On High Alert After US Bombs Iranian Nuclear Sites
content: The New York Police Department (NYPD) announced enhanced deployments to religious, cultural, and diplomatic sites throughout the city.

title: "Every American A Target": Iranian Media's Big Warning After US Attacks
content: Iranian state television on Sunday has reportedly warned that "every American citizen or military personnel" in the Middle East is now on Tehran's "target" following US airstrikes on Iran's three nuclear sites-- including Fordow, Natanz and Isfahan.

title: "Our Turn To Act Without Delay": Iran's Warning After US Bombs Nuclear Sites
content: Iran has previously, on multiple occasions, threatened to block the Strait of Hormuz but never followed through.

title: B2 Bombers, Bunker Busters, Tomahawks: The Weapons US Used To Strike Iran
content: The US has joined Israel's war against Iran, bombing Tehran's three key nuclear facilities with precision strikes. Washington, DC has used high-end weaponry, including the dreaded GBU-57 bunker busters and Tomahawk cruise missiles

title: About US GBU-57, Only Buster Bomb Capable Of Hitting Iran's Nuclear Sites
content: A powerful American bunker-busting bomb is the only weapon capable of destroying Iran's deeply buried nuclear facilities, making it President Donald Trump's weapon of choice if he chooses to militarily back Israel.

title: Madrid hopeful Mbappé returns in last group game
content: Xabi Alonso says Kylian Mbappé is "better" as he recovers from gastroenteritis . the french international has not travelled with the team to Charlotte, North Carolina . he was hospitalized this week after being hospitalized .

title: 'Best pitcher on the planet': Anderson's historic outing has LSU one win from title
content: Kade Anderson strikes out 10 in game 1 of men's college world series finals . the 20-year-old threw only the second complete game of his collegiate career . he also shutout just the third complete game shutout seen in the current 22-year era .

title: From crowd-surfing with the Stanley Cup to Dairy Queen: Inside Brad Marchand's post-title tour
content: it's been 14 years since Brad Marchand last had the chance to party with the Stanley Cup . he's older and wiser -- in the sense that he won't be getting a misspelled tattoo . but the man still knows how to celebrate a championship .

title: What's wrong with the Aces? Breaking down Las Vegas' slow start
content: the Las Vegas Aces are 5-6, having lost four of their past five . they are tied for seventh place in the WNBA in scoring average, offensive and defensive rating and net rating . three-time MVP A'ja Wilson has missed the past three games in concussion protocol .

title: Draft trades: Five deals that would shake up the first round
content: the NBA offseason has officially arrived . there are massive storylines yet to resolve, including the Los Angeles Lakers sale . the NBA draft is just days away, and free agency just days after that . here are five trades featuring 10 different teams .

title: Ranking the Premier League's £100m transfers after Wirtz
content: the 22-year-old midfielder will become only the fifth player to move to (or within) the premier league for over £100m . arne slot convinced Florian Wirtz to chose Liverpool over other rivals . we rank the previous four based on how successful they've been .

content: the club world cup transfer window has closed . but the club's main window is open with the rest of Europe to follow on July 1 . sportsmail's reporters hearing about possible deals every Friday until September . title: All returning athletes in Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 3 + 4 revealed
content: a total of 21 skaters from the original games and other series entries return in THPS 3 + 4 . illustrious names like Elissa Steamer, the first female skater to become playable in the franchise in the original Tony Hawk's Pro Skater, and rodney Mullen, the iconic originator .

title: Political succession in Andhra Pradesh’s SPSR Nellore district sees next generation leaders emerging
content: Andhra Pradesh’s SPSR Nellore district is expected to get young and fresh blood ahead of the next general elections

title: In Frames: Between life and livelihood for Mumbai’s train commuters
content: Another train accident lays bare the precarious conditions faced by Mumbai’s suburban rail commuters as they face the daily struggle of surviving trips between work and home

title: Periya case convict K Manikandan resigns as Kanhangad block panchayat president
content: His resignation comes as the Election Commission is set to announce its decision on a complaint filed by Congress leader Baburaj, seeking his disqualification following the Ernakulam CBI court’s conviction

title: Pahalgam terror attack: NIA arrests two men for harbouring terrorists
content: The accused have been identified as Parvaiz Ahmad Jothar from Batkote, Pahalgam, and Bashir Ahmad Jothar of Hill Park, Pahalgam

title: Militant arrested; arms, ammunition seized in Manipur
content: “A large cache of arms and ammunition were also seized in separate search operations in Imphal East and Kakching districts,” a police statement said

title: Massive blaze at chemical factory in Bengal’s Barasat; godowns gutted, 20 engines rushed to the spot
content: Fire and Emergency Service minister Sujit Bose says green corridors for fire engines may be in the pipeline

title: Iran-Israel War: India ramps up oil imports from Russia, U.S. in June
content: The U.S. military struck three sites in Iran early Sunday, directly joining Israel which first struck Iranian nuclear sites on June 13.

title: Speed limit likely to rise for heavy vehicles on Mumbai-Pune Expressway’s ghat stretch
content: The current speed limit of 60 kmph for cars in the 10-km ghat section is unlikely to be changed. On other stretches of the country’s first access-controlled expressway, the speed limit is 100 kmph for smaller vehicles and 80 kmph for heavy vehicles

title: Himachal CM Sukhu directs firm action against developers for undue delay in hydropower projects
content: The Chief Minister asserted that undue delay in the project execution are causing significant losses to the State exchequer

title: Study finds public health spending has not resulted in significant pro-poor services in India
content: ‘Results at the national level show a patchy distribution of equality in public spending between urban and rural people’

title: Two arrested for allegedly assaulting and abusing Dalit lawyer
content: A video of the incident was widely circulated on social media, and the public demanded immediate action.

title: Tamil Nadu teenager kidnap case: Love, abduction and trial of an ADGP
content: While the abduction of a young man from a village in Tiruvallur went unnoticed, what happened later grabbed the headlines. Following up on a case filed by the mother of the boy, the police said their investigation had revealed the involvement of an MLA, a former SI and even a senior IPS officer. R. Sivaraman examines the many twists and turns the case underwent before the Supreme Court stepped in.

title: ‘War on Drugs’: Punjab Cabinet gives formal approval to panel overseeing campaign against drug abuse
content: Punjab Cabinet intensifies ‘War on Drugs’ program, Congress criticises AAP for unsuccessful campaign and also approves recruitment in Jails Department

title: What’s the biggest challenge in DNA analysis? | Explained
content: What are short tandem repeats? Why is STR the most widely used genetic marker for identifying humans? Why is sample quality, data analysis, and its interpretation important? How can contamination or degradation of samples be overcome?

title: Dream schools in making: Mohan Majhi Governmet’s big push for primary education
content: The Odisha government launches the Godabarish Mishra Adarsha Prathamik Vidyalaya scheme to establish high-quality primary schools, aiming to revolutionise education in rural areas

title: FATF report links dual-use cargo seized by India in 2020 to Pakistan missile agency
content: Indian investigators found that items seized from vessel Da Cui Yun at Kandla port in Gujarat were ‘autoclaves’, which were used in missile motors, says the report

title: Nursing staff locks orthopaedic ward lavatory of Tripura’s main hospital citing cleaning issue, patients protest
content: Protest at GBP Hospital due to locked lavatory; negligence and misbehaviour allegations; cleaning services blamed for substandard maintenance

title: West Bengal BJP chief faces flak over ‘sex workers’ remark
content: Trinamool Congress demanded an unconditional apology from Sukanta Majumdar for comparing West  Bengal’s law and order situation to “sex workers”

title: Uproar over power cut in U.P. hospital; Opposition targets government
content: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav demands accountability following a viral video showing patients in Hardoi district hospital using handmade fans due to power cuts

title: Air India starts releasing interim compensation of ₹25 lakh each to relatives of crash victims, survivors
content: The airline provides interim compensation and support to families affected by the Ahmedabad plane crash, including medical and financial assistance

title: Student leader’s arrest from varsity in Jaipur sparks political row
content: Nirmal Chaudhary picked up from exam hall; police book him in three-year-old case; Congress leaders term move ‘violation of democratic rights’, accuse government of targeting Opposition voices

title: We shouldn’t expect smooth sailing all time: Jaishankar on neighbourhood ties, volatility
content: External Affairs Minister discusses foreign policy, regional stability, and counter-terrorism strategies during an interactive session

title: Tamil Nadu seeks GI tags for five agricultural products to boost farmer benefits
content: As per the Tamil Nadu Agriculture Budget 2025-26, a total of ₹15 lakh will be allocated to obtain GI for the five products — Nallur Varagu, a variety of millet (Cuddalore); Vedharanyam Mullai, (Nagapattinam); Natham Puli, (Dindigul); Ayakudi Koyya (Dindigul), and Kappalpatti Karumbu Murungai (Dindigul)

title: More than 3,500 persons with disabilities to be nominated to local bodies in first phase: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: He say the appointed members can participate in local council meetings and will receive honorariums on a par with elected members

title: Three-wheeler EV adoption gains traction in Tamil Nadu
content: As per data available on Vahan portal, 2,802 electric three-wheelers have been registered till May 2025; EV penetration in T.N. stands at 16.07% in 2025 so far, as compared to 13.92% in 2024

title: Woman found ‘beaten to death’
content: Her face and body had injuries and bruises and her arm seemed broken near the shoulder. Her brother, friend arrested

title: Ahmedabad plane crash: 247 victims identified through DNA tests; 232 bodies given to kin as of June 21
content: Authorities are carrying out DNA tests to establish the identity of the victims, as many bodies were charred beyond recognition as the aircraft burst into flames or damaged on impact

title: Won’t allow teachers to be involved in fresh caste survey, says Madhu Bangarappa
content: The Education Minister said he had conveyed to the government that he could not allow teachers to be involved in the process to collect data for the scio-economic and educational survey.

title: KMF plans to set up more Cafe Moo outlets in city
content: Cafe Moo outlets have become a favourite among customers to access multiple Nandini products at the same place as well as a hangout spot for the others.

title: DNPA calls for protection of copyright in AI model training on news content
content: The DNPA, which represents traditional news publishers with a digital presence, said that AI model developers should compensate news publishers fairly for training on their content

title: MP cites need for skywalks to link Ernakulam Town, Thripunithura railway stations with adjacent metro stops
content: A joint meeting of officials from KMRL, the Railway, local bodies, and MLAs must be convened to chart out a concrete plan of action, since the intermodal linkages can serve as a model for integrated urban transport and significantly enhance the commuting experience in Kochi, says Hibi Eden

title: Treat Shabir Shah without delay, J&K leaders appeal to Home Minister
content: CPI(M) leader Tarigami, J&K Apni Party president Altaf Bukhari and PDP chief Mehbooba appeal for bail on medical grounds

title: Invoking anti-gangster law to counter one communal violence incident triggered by a social media post is misuse: SC
content: “The power conferred upon the State cannot be wielded as an instrument of harassment or intimidation, particularly where political motivations may be at play,” says Justice Sandeep Mehta’s judgment

title: Flood-like situation in South Bengal as rain, DVC water release raise river levels
content: Paschim Midnapore, Bankura, Hooghly, and Howrah among affected districts; evacuation, relief efforts underway

title: Kerala student returns in special flight from Iran
content: She had gone to Tehran in September 2024 to pursue the MBBS programme at Shahid Beheshti University of Medical Sciences, Tehran

title: Delay in FoB construction on Bengaluru-Mysuru highway raises pedestrian safety concerns
content: Of the 24 planned structures, only a handful have reached completion, with many still at the foundation or pillar stage though the construction officially commenced in October 2024

title: Cop turns his composition into video album featuring colleagues
content: Assistant sub-inspector A. Ajithdev has composed nearly 10 songs since joining the force 23 years ago

title: Enough Plus One seats in schools in State:  Sivankutty
content: General Education Minister says  1,13,476 Plus One seats are vacant across the State after the main allotment process, adding revised mid-day meal menu has been rolled out after proper study

title: Karnataka govt. orders ‘Mobile-based AI Driven Facial Recognition Attendance System’ in all govt. and aided schools
content: The government has developed a separate mobile application for this system and has included all information of students in the Students Achievement Tracking System

title: Rohith Vemula Bill proposes to cut govt. aid to institutions for violating rules
content: The government proposes to enact the legislation to eliminate caste- and identity-based discrimination in educational institutions

title: ‘Youth from families who benefited from land reforms, welfare schemes are now swayed by Hindutva politics’
content: The KPCC committee, which visited Dakshina Kannada district and met people from all walks of life, has submitted its interim report looking at the reasons for the communal polarisation there

title: Chennai-bound Indigo flight makes emergency landing in Bengaluru
content: Indigo spokesperson said the airline made a “mayday” call before it landed in Bengaluru, as it "ran out of fuel".

title: Clash erupts during ABVP-Yuva Morcha protest against Minister Sivankutty
content: SFI and DYFI activists allegedly attacked the ABVP and Yuva Morcha members even while they were in police custody.

title: Disfigured skull found in vacant plot at Kumbalanghi
content: The skull, with the jaw allegedly missing, will be sent to the police surgeon for DNA profiling and gender identification

title: Local bodies achieving complete yoga integration will be honoured: Veena George
content: Move intends to inspire local bodies and encourage widespread adoption of yoga practices at grassroots level. Strong intervention by AYUSH department aims to popularise yoga across the State

title: India Post helps transform geolocation with DIGIPIN
content: The 10- digit alpha-numeric code represents geographic coordinates, developed by creating a uniform 4x4 metre grid of the country

title: Kerala Tourism remains most visited travel website in the country
content: It surpassed the Union government’s ‘Incredible India’ website that came second, according to analytics company Similarweb.

title: BJP worker found dead in Bengal’s Hooghly, party alleges ‘political murder’
content: The man’s family alleges that Trinamool Congress workers had assaulted him in the past. The ruling party says the BJP is ‘adding political colour’ to the tragedy

title: Rust and resolve: Thrissur’s anti-drug installation sends a bold message
content: With scrap metal and vision, sculptor Davinchi Suresh gives form to Thrissur’s war on drugs. The sculpture is created from over 3.5 tonnes of discarded metal — gear wheels, nuts, bolts, and sheet metal
